intro: Sanguisorba diandra, commonly known as the redroot dropwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flower clusters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces upright spikes of small, pinkish-red flowers. Sanguisorba diandra typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
